targets.query: SELECT last("cpu_idle")  * -1 +100 FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s)
SELECT last("filer_total_share_clients") FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)
SELECT max("cpula1") FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.description: Disk I/O Operations Max over 1/5/15 mins

targets.query: SELECT max("diskiola1") FROM "nasuni_disk" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "diskiodevice"

panels.title: Appliance Disk I/O Load Avg

panels.description: Shows cache growth over a longer period of time, useful if you need to decide to increase the size of the cache
panels.title: Cache Status

targets.query: SELECT (last("mem_total_real") - (last("mem_avail_real") + last("mem_cached"))) / last("mem_total_real") * 100 FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(null)

panels.description: Data that is yet to be snapped to your storage
panels.title: Unprotected Data

targets.query: SELECT (mean("filer_cache_used") / mean("filer_cache_total")) * 100 FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(null)
SELECT last("filer_total_share_clients") FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)

panels.description: Disk I/O Operations Max over 1/5/15 mins

targets.query: SELECT max("diskiola5") FROM "nasuni_disk" WHERE ("agent_host" =~ /^$Appliance$/ AND "diskiodevice" = 'sdc') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "diskiodevice"
SELECT max("diskiola5") FROM "nasuni_disk" WHERE ("agent_host" =~ /^$Appliance$/ AND "diskiodevice" = 'sdc') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "diskiodevice"
SELECT max("diskiola5") FROM "nasuni_disk" WHERE ("agent_host" =~ /^$Appliance$/ AND "diskiodevice" = 'sdc') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "diskiodevice"

panels.title: Cache Disk I/O Load Avg

panels.description: This graph allows you to monitor cache activity in a little more detail.  eg What your % cache hit ratio looks like.

targets.query: SELECT last("filer_read_hits") FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)
SELECT last("filer_read_misses") FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)
SELECT last("filer_read_misses") / (last("filer_read_hits") + last("filer_read_misses")) * 100 FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)

panels.title: Cache Activity

targets.query: SELECT mean("filer_online") FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT (last("mem_total_real") - (last("mem_avail_real") + last("mem_cached"))) / last("mem_total_real") * 100 FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(null)

panels.description: Shows cache growth over a longer period of time, useful if you need to decide to increase the size of the cache
panels.title: Cache History

panels.description: Number of connected SMB users over time

targets.query: SELECT last("filer_total_share_clients") FROM "Nasuni" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)

panels.title: Users (History)

targets.query: SELECT mean("filer_cache_total") FROM "ngfs" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$Appliance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "Nasuni" WITH KEY = "customer"
list.label: Customer
list.name: Customer
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "Nasuni" WITH KEY = "customer"

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "Nasuni" WITH KEY = "region" WHERE customer =~ /$Customer/
list.label: Region
list.name: Region
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "Nasuni" WITH KEY = "region" WHERE customer =~ /$Customer/

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "Nasuni" WITH KEY = "hostname" WHERE customer =~ /$Customer/ AND Region =~ /$Region/
list.label: Appliance
list.name: Appliance
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "Nasuni" WITH KEY = "hostname" WHERE customer =~ /$Customer/ AND Region =~ /$Region/
